main event: Three witnesses observed a bright object performing erratic movements in the eastern part of the sky on December 7, 1966.
interesting points: The sighting lasted about five to ten seconds., The object was described as larger than a star and seemed to shimmer., The object could have been misidentified as the bright star Sirius, which was visible low on the horizon., Multiple reports of similar sightings were received by the Air Force during November and December 1966., The atmosphere's distortion, called scintillation, was mentioned as a possible explanation for the observations.
sighted object: a bright object in the sky
